result.markdown:
# Live Case: S&P500 (2 of 3) *Aug 10, 2023 -=-* Agenda: Understanding the S&P500 Index ## S&P 500 Data - PRELIMINARY SETUP 1. We will continue our analysis of the S&P 500. Load the data, as described in the chapter Live Case: S&P500 (1 of 3) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Read S&P500 stock data present in a Google Sheet. library(gsheet) prefix <- "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/" sheetID <- "11ahk9uWxBkDqrhNm7qYmiTwrlSC53N1zvXYfv7ttOCM" url500 <- paste(prefix,sheetID) # Form the URL to connect to sp500 <- gsheet2tbl(url500) # Read it into a tibble called sp500 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` No encoding supplied: defaulting to UTF-8. ``` ::: ::: 2. Rename columns, as described in the chapter Live Case: S&P500 (1 of 3). ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(dplyr)) # Define a mapping of new column names new_names <- c( "Date", "Stock", "StockName", "Sector", "Industry", "MarketCap", "Price", "Low52Wk", "High52Wk", "ROE", "ROA", "ROIC", "GrossMargin", "OperatingMargin", "NetMargin", "PE", "PB", "EVEBITDA", "EBITDA", "EPS", "EBITDA_YOY", "EBITDA_QYOY", "EPS_YOY", "EPS_QYOY", "PFCF", "FCF", "FCF_QYOY", "DebtToEquity", "CurrentRatio", "QuickRatio", "DividendYield", "DividendsPerShare_YOY", "PS", "Revenue_YOY", "Revenue_QYOY", "Rating" ) # Rename the columns using the new_names vector sp500 <- sp500 %>% rename_with(~ new_names, everything()) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: 3. Remove Rows containing no data or Null values, as described in the chapter Live Case: S&P500 (1 of 3). ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Check for blank or null values in the "Stock" column hasNull <- any(sp500$Stock == "" | is.null(sp500$Stock)) if (hasNull) { # Remove rows with null or blank values from the dataframe tibble sp500 <- sp500[!(is.null(sp500$Stock) | sp500$Stock == ""), ] } ``` ::: 4. The S&P500 shares are divided into multiple Sectors. Thus, model Sector as a factor() variable, as described in the chapter Live Case: S&P500 (1 of 3). ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sp500$Sector <- as.factor(sp500$Sector) ``` ::: 5. Stock Ratings: The S&P500 shares have Technical Ratings such as {Buy, Sell, ..}. Model the data column Rating as a factor() variable, as described in the chapter Live Case: S&P500 (1 of 3). ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sp500$Rating <- as.factor(sp500$Rating) ``` ::: 6. Low52WkPerc: Create a new column to track Share Prices relative to their 52 Week Low, as described in the chapter Live Case: S&P500 (1 of 3). ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sp500 <- sp500 %>% mutate(Low52WkPerc = round((Price - Low52Wk)*100 / Low52Wk,2)) colnames(sp500) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "Date" "Stock" "StockName" [4] "Sector" "Industry" "MarketCap" [7] "Price" "Low52Wk" "High52Wk" [10] "ROE" "ROA" "ROIC" [13] "GrossMargin" "OperatingMargin" "NetMargin" [16] "PE" "PB" "EVEBITDA" [19] "EBITDA" "EPS" "EBITDA_YOY" [22] "EBITDA_QYOY" "EPS_YOY" "EPS_QYOY" [25] "PFCF" "FCF" "FCF_QYOY" [28] "DebtToEquity" "CurrentRatio" "QuickRatio" [31] "DividendYield" "DividendsPerShare_YOY" "PS" [34] "Revenue_YOY" "Revenue_QYOY" "Rating" [37] "Low52WkPerc" ``` ::: ::: Well done! Our data is now ready for analysis!! 7. Creating a new column MarketCapBillions = MarketCap/1000,000,000 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sp500 <- sp500 %>% mutate(MarketCapBillions = MarketCap/ 1000000000) colnames(sp500) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "Date" "Stock" "StockName" [4] "Sector" "Industry" "MarketCap" [7] "Price" "Low52Wk" "High52Wk" [10] "ROE" "ROA" "ROIC" [13] "GrossMargin" "OperatingMargin" "NetMargin" [16] "PE" "PB" "EVEBITDA" [19] "EBITDA" "EPS" "EBITDA_YOY" [22] "EBITDA_QYOY" "EPS_YOY" "EPS_QYOY" [25] "PFCF" "FCF" "FCF_QYOY" [28] "DebtToEquity" "CurrentRatio" "QuickRatio" [31] "DividendYield" "DividendsPerShare_YOY" "PS" [34] "Revenue_YOY" "Revenue_QYOY" "Rating" [37] "Low52WkPerc" "MarketCapBillions" ``` ::: ::: ## ANALYSIS OF S&P500 SECTORS 1. Number of shares in Each Sector ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(kableExtra) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'kableExtra' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following object is masked from 'package:dplyr': group_rows ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(janitor) # This package helps us auto generate the total at the bottom of a table. ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'janitor' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': chisq.test, fisher.test ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} tab1 <- table(Sector = sp500$Sector) tab2 <- as.data.frame(tab1) tab3 <- tab2 %>% arrange(desc(Freq)) tab4 <- tab3 %>% adorn_totals("row") tab5 <- knitr::kable(tab4, "html") %>% kable_styling() tab5 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Sector Freq
Finance 92
Technology Services 50
Electronic Technology 49
Health Technology 47
Consumer Non-Durables 31
Producer Manufacturing 31
Utilities 31
Consumer Services 29
Process Industries 24
Retail Trade 23
Energy Minerals 16
Transportation 15
Commercial Services 13
Consumer Durables 12
Health Services 12
Distribution Services 9
Industrial Services 9
Non-Energy Minerals 7
Communications 3
Total 503
````` ::: ::: 2. Barplot for Showing Number of Stocks in Each Sector ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggplot2) ggplot(sp500, aes(Sector)) + geom_bar() + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, vjust = 1, hjust = 1)) + geom_text(aes(label = ..count..), stat = "count", vjust = 1.5, colour = "white") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](11LiveCase02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=768} ::: ::: 3. Number of shares By Rating ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(janitor) # This package helps us auto generate the total at the bottom of a table. tab1 <- table(Rating = sp500$Rating) tab2 <- as.data.frame(tab1) tab3 <- tab2 %>% arrange(desc(Freq)) tab4 <- tab3 %>% adorn_totals("row") tab5 <- knitr::kable(tab4, "html") %>% kable_styling() tab5 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Rating Freq
Sell 203
Buy 130
Neutral 85
Strong Sell 72
Strong Buy 13
Total 503
````` ::: ::: 4. Pie Chart Showing Number of shares By Rating ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggpubr) # Compute counts of each Rating Rating_count <- as.data.frame(table(sp500$Rating)) colnames(Rating_count) <- c("Rating", "n") # Calculate proportions Rating_count$prop <- Rating_count$n / sum(Rating_count$n) # Create labels that display proportions as percentages Rating_count$labels <- paste0(round(Rating_count$prop*100, 2), "%") # Create the pie chart ggpie(data = Rating_count, x = "n", fill = "Rating", label = "labels", palette = "jco", title = "Pie Chart of Rating") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](11LiveCase02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=768} ::: ::: 5. Number of shares in Each Sector By Rating ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(janitor) # This package helps us auto generate the total at the bottom of a table. tab1 <- table(Rating = sp500$Rating, Sector = sp500$Sector) tab2 <- as.data.frame(tab1) tab3 <- tab2 %>% arrange(desc(Freq)) # excluding rows having 0 counts tab3 <- subset(tab3 ,Freq > 0 ) tab4 <- tab3 %>% adorn_totals("row") tab5 <- knitr::kable(tab4, "html") %>% kable_styling() tab5 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Rating Sector Freq
Buy Finance 31
Sell Electronic Technology 27
Sell Finance 27
Sell Technology Services 27

Sell Consumer Services 17

Neutral Process Industries 1
Total - 503
````` ::: ::: ### MARKET CAP 1. Market Cap of all companies by Sector ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(janitor) # This package helps us auto generate the total at the bottom of a table. library(kableExtra) # Market Cap by Sector MCap <- sp500 %>% group_by(Sector) %>% summarise( MarketCapBi = sum(MarketCapBillions)) # Total Market Cap of the entire S&P 500 (in Millions) SP500MarketCapBi <- sum(sp500$MarketCapBillions) # calculating % market cap PercentMarketCap <- round(MCap$MarketCapBi*100/SP500MarketCapBi,2) MCapTab <- cbind(MCap,PercentMarketCap) # sorting by PercentMarketCap MCapTab <- MCapTab %>% arrange(desc(PercentMarketCap)) # Use package janitor to add sums at the bottom of the table MCapTab <- MCapTab %>% adorn_totals("row") # Use package knittr to format the appearance of the table MCapTab <- knitr::kable(MCapTab, "html") %>% kable_styling() MCapTab ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Sector MarketCapBi PercentMarketCap
Technology Services 9389.67 22.63
Electronic Technology 6881.89 16.59
Finance 4817.87 11.61
Health Technology 3904.67 9.41
Retail Trade 3084.19 7.43

Producer Manufacturing 1406.97 3.39
Consumer Services 1403.52 3.38

Process Industries 791.45 1.91
Transportation 700.13 1.69
Industrial Services 405.70 0.98
Communications 398.00 0.96
Distribution Services 310.00 0.75
Non-Energy Minerals 217.47 0.52
Total 41489.47 100.00
````` ::: ::: 2. Summary Statistics of Market Cap (in Billion) by each Sector of S&P500 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} SectorMC <- sp500 %>% group_by(Sector) %>% summarise( Total = sum(na.omit(MarketCapBillions)), Median= median(na.omit(MarketCapBillions)), Mean= mean(na.omit(MarketCapBillions))) tab <- cbind(Sector = SectorMC$Sector, round(SectorMC[,2:4],2)) SMcap <- knitr::kable(tab, "html") %>% kable_styling() SMcap ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Sector Total Median Mean
Commercial Services 1272.59 31.10 97.89

````` ::: ::: 3. Top 10 companies having highest Market Cap ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} Top10 <- sp500 %>% arrange(desc(MarketCapBillions)) %>% head(10) Top10 <- `Top10`[,c(1:4,10:13,38)] Top10 <- knitr::kable(Top10, "html") %>% kable_styling() Top10 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Date Stock StockName Sector ROE ROA ROIC GrossMargin MarketCapBillions
8/10/2023 AAPL Apple Inc. Electronic Technology 146.00 27.600 57.177930 43.18103 3010

8/10/2023 V Visa Inc. Commercial Services 43.60 18.600 28.104180 76.95643 485
````` ::: ::: ### PRICE RELATIVE TO 52 WEEK LOW 1. Summary Statistics of Low52WkPerc by Sector ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} SM <- sp500 %>% group_by(Sector) %>% summarise( Mean = mean(na.omit(Low52WkPerc)), Median= sd(na.omit(Low52WkPerc)), Median= median(na.omit(Low52WkPerc)), Q1 = quantile(na.omit(Low52WkPerc), probs = 0.25, na.rm = TRUE), Q3 = quantile(na.omit(Low52WkPerc), probs = 0.75, na.rm = TRUE), Min = min(na.omit(Low52WkPerc)), Max = max(na.omit(Low52WkPerc)) ) tab <- cbind(Sector = SM$Sector, round(SM[,2:7],2)) tab <- tab %>% arrange(Median) SM <- knitr::kable(tab, "html") %>% kable_styling() SM ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Sector Mean Median Q1 Q3 Min Max
Communications 6.03 5.23 5.02 6.65 4.80 8.07

Non-Energy Minerals 44.31 51.04 35.05 57.78 7.74 65.74
````` ::: ::: Sector Communications and Utilities are closest to its 52 week low. 2. Box Plot for Low52WkPerc by Sector ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggplot2) ggplot(sp500, aes(Sector, Low52WkPerc)) + geom_boxplot() + scale_y_continuous(limits=c(0,100)) + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, vjust = 1, hjust = 1)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](11LiveCase02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=768} ::: ::: ### PROFITABILITY BY SECTOR ### ROE 1. Summary Statistics of ROE by each Sector of S&P500 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} SectorROE <- sp500 %>% group_by(Sector) %>% summarise( Mean = mean(na.omit(ROE)), Median= sd(na.omit(ROE)), Median= median(na.omit(ROE)), Min = min(na.omit(ROE)), Max = max(na.omit(ROE)) ) tab <- cbind(Sector = SectorROE$Sector, round(SectorROE[,2:5],2)) tab <- knitr::kable(tab, "html") %>% kable_styling() tab ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Sector Mean Median Min Max
Commercial Services 37.60 26.40 3.50 175.0

Consumer Durables 13.56 17.75 -51.40 45.2
Consumer Non-Durables 132.99 18.15 -10.80 2880.0

````` ::: ::: 2. Box Plot for ROE by Sector ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggplot2) ggplot(sp500, aes(Sector, ROE)) + geom_boxplot() + scale_y_continuous(limits=c(0,500)) + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, vjust = 1, hjust = 1)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](11LiveCase02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=768} ::: ::: ### ROA 1. Summary Statistics of ROA by each Sector of S&P500 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} SectorROA <- sp500 %>% group_by(Sector) %>% summarise( Mean = mean(na.omit(ROA)), Median= sd(na.omit(ROA)), Median= median(na.omit(ROA)), Min = min(na.omit(ROA)), max = max(na.omit(ROA)) ) tab <- cbind(Sector = SectorROA$Sector, round(SectorROA[,2:5],2)) tab <- knitr::kable(tab, "html") %>% kable_styling() tab ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Sector Mean Median Min max
Commercial Services 10.10 6.60 1.74 27.20

Consumer Non-Durables 7.37 6.81 -5.57 18.90

Utilities 2.32 2.55 -6.25 6.49
````` ::: ::: 2. Box Plot for ROA by Sector ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggplot2) ggplot(sp500, aes(Sector, ROA)) + geom_boxplot() + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, vjust = 1, hjust = 1)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](11LiveCase02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-22-1.png){width=768} ::: :::
